Module COMP2042.CW.hfyxc3
Package brickdestroyer.model.game

Class GameLogic

java.lang.Object
brickdestroyer.model.game.GameLogic
public class GameLogic extends Object
Game logic contains all the basic behavior of how entities interact with each other and the overall state of the game. This class instantiate all the available entities and keep track of the resources needed throughout the game of Brick Destroyer.

    GameLogic(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle drawArea, javafx.geometry.Point2D initialPosition)
    Initialize the resources and properties before starting the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameLogic

      public GameLogic(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle drawArea, javafx.geometry.Point2D initialPosition)
      Initialize the resources and properties before starting the game.
      Parameters:
      drawArea - a Rectangle shape that defines the width and height of game window.
      initialPosition - an initial Point2D x and y position of where the player and ball should start.

  • Method Details

    • move

      public void move()
      Move and update the player and ball position. This method is called to allow continuous movement as it updates the player and ball's position in the game frame.

    • resetPoint

      public void resetPoint()
      Resets the ball and player to its initial position. This method is called when a level is completed or all ball is lost.

    • wallReset

      public void wallReset()
      Resets the structure of the wall and resets the ball count to 3. This method is called when all ball is lost the all the ball or when the player is tweaking in the debug console.

    • nextLevel

      public void nextLevel()
      Move and retrieve the brick count for the next level. This method is called when all the brick in the current level is destroyed level or when the player is tweaking in the debug console.

    • initialiseBallSpeed

      public void initialiseBallSpeed()
      This method is called to initialize the starting x and y speed of the ball using a rng factor. The value of the initial speed y is always negative to make sure the ball travel upwards the screen.

    • findImpacts

      public void findImpacts()
      This is the master method for handling the impact between entity and wall of the game window. It changes the property of the class after an impact.

    • defaultScoreCalculation

      public void defaultScoreCalculation()
      This method is called by findImpact() method to introduce a penalty to the score if the user loses a ball in the level. It makes deduct the current available score and make sure the score wouldn't be negative.

    • setImpact

      public boolean setImpact(Player player, Ball ball)
      This method is called findImpacts() to detect the impact between player and ball.
      Parameters:
      player - a Player object that is controlling by the user in the game window.
      ball - a Ball object that is currently in the game window.
      Returns:
      a Boolean that is true if there is an impact between player and ball, false if there isn't.

    • speedUp

      public void speedUp(boolean isSpeedUp)
      This method is called by impactWall() when the ball impact a Haste Brick. It sets the speed of the ball to the highest possible randomize value of initializeSpeed() method.
      Parameters:
      isSpeedUp - a Boolean that represent true if the ball impacted the Haste Brick, false if there isn't.

    • impactBrick

      public final Brick.ImpactDirection impactBrick(Brick brick, Ball ball)
      This method is called by impactWall() to determine the direction of the ball impact on the bricks. This method return the enum value of the Brick ImpactDirection.
      Parameters:
      brick - a Brick object that is impacted by the ball.
      ball - a Ball object that impacted the brick.
      Returns:
      a ImpactDirection enum value that represent the direction of the ball impact.

    • hasLevel

      public boolean hasLevel()
      This method is called to check if there is more playable level.
      Returns:
      a Boolean that represent true if there is more playable level, false if there isn't.

    • ballEnd

      public boolean ballEnd()
      This method is called to check if the current ball count is 0.
      Returns:
      a Boolean that represent true if the ballCount is 0, false if it isn't.

    • isDone

      public boolean isDone()
      This method is called to check if all brick is destroyed.
      Returns:
      a Boolean that represent true if the brickCount is 0, false if it isn't.

    • isBallLost

      public boolean isBallLost()
      This method is called to check if the ball is lost
      Returns:
      a Boolean that represent true if the ballLost is 0, false if it isn't;

    • setBallSpeedX

      public void setBallSpeedX(int speedX)
      Setter method for the travelling speed of the ball object in the x plane. Speed x is the rate in pixels which the ball travel in every frame of the game window.
      Parameters:
      speedX - an integer that can be positive and negative value. Negative value traverse the ball to the left of the screen while positive traverse the ball to the right.

    • setBallSpeedY

      public void setBallSpeedY(int speedY)
      Setter method for the travelling speed of the ball object in the y plane. Speed y is the rate in pixels which the ball travel in every frame of the game window.
      Parameters:
      speedY - an integer that can be positive and negative value. It is usually set to negative from the start the traverse the ball to the top of the screen. Negative value traverse the ball to the top of the game window while positive traverse the ball to the bottom.

    • setBricks

      public void setBricks(Brick[] bricks)
      Setter method to set the Bricks object.
      Parameters:
      bricks - a Brick object.

    • setBrickCount

      public void setBrickCount(int brickCount)
      Setter method to set the number of brick for the level.
      Parameters:
      brickCount - the number of brick for the level.

    • resetBallCount

      public void resetBallCount()
      This method is called to reset the ball count of the game.

    • getBallCount

      public int getBallCount()
      Getter method for the number of ball in the game.
      Returns:
      an Integer that represent the number of ball.

    • getBrickCount

      public int getBrickCount()
      Getter method for the number of brick available in the level.
      Returns:
      an Integer that represent the number of brick.

    • getScore

      public int getScore()
      Getter method for setting the score of the player in the game. Score cannot be negative value.
      Returns:
      an Integer that contains the total score obtain by the user at the moment.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Getter method for the Player object.
      Returns:
      the Player object in the game board.

    • getBall

      public Ball getBall()
      Getter method for the Ball object.
      Returns:
      the Ball object in the game board.

    • getBricks

      public Brick[] getBricks()
      Getter method for the Bricks in the current level of the game.
      Returns:
      a 1d array that contains the bricks of the current level.

    • getCurrentLevel

      public int getCurrentLevel()
      Getter method for the current level the player is in.
      Returns:
      an Integer that contains the current level the player is in.
